results.content:
Les exemples sont répétitifs (peu de différence entre l'exemple gameofthrone et la meteo). Certains tutoriaux gratuits sur internet sont beaucoup mieux faits.
L'instructeur n'a pas bien préparé son cours, et il y a parfois des videos entières où on le voit chercher à résoudre un bug. Une fois ca peut-etre instructif mais ca revient 2 ou 3 fois dans le cours. La vignette de l'instructeur cache parfois des elements de l'ecran importants.
L'animation de l'instructeur n'est pas très motivante.
results.content_html:
Les exemples sont répétitifs (peu de différence entre l'exemple gameofthrone et la meteo). Certains tutoriaux gratuits sur internet sont beaucoup mieux faits.

L'animation de l'instructeur n'est pas très motivante.

results.content: Material is slightly dated. Names of things have changed. The UI to build intents, entities works differently in some cases than what the course shows. Couldn't get all the projects and/or code samples to work.
results.content_html: Material is slightly dated. Names of things have changed. The UI to build intents, entities works differently in some cases than what the course shows. Couldn't get all the projects and/or code samples to work.

results.content: Overall, a very good course and I learned a lot. My only criticism is that it may need updating due to changes in the Dialogflow interface, and changes to the newer version of node now implemented in AWS Lambda. These were minor in most of the projects, but I had to do quite a lot of code rewriting for the Pokemon Go app. This might be an issue for someone with no coding experience, but it gave me an opportunity to practice my debugging skills!

response.content: Thank you Barbara for your review.

results.content_html: Overall, a very good course and I learned a lot. My only criticism is that it may need updating due to changes in the Dialogflow interface, and changes to the newer version of node now implemented in AWS Lambda. These were minor in most of the projects, but I had to do quite a lot of code rewriting for the Pokemon Go app. This might be an issue for someone with no coding experience, but it gave me an opportunity to practice my debugging skills!

results.content: The content was interesting and decent. The issue for me was there was too much time spend on troubleshooting simple things. This could have been solved with some simple preparation and/or video editing.

response.content: Thanks Jason for the review. Debugging is an important step in developing, but I understand your point. I'll keep things short and to the point.

results.content: Terrible audio or maybe he was so tired, I dont know. I don't think this is worth paying for. I want a refund!
results.content_html: Terrible audio or maybe he was so tired, I dont know. I don't think this is worth paying for. I want a refund!

results.content: Very bad audio, Presenters screen often blocks out the detail you need to see on the desktop shown,  Does not explain console, as if you make a mistake, how you can correct it.    Very confusing.  Also the intro chimes very quickly become annoying, I find myself skipping the first 8 seconds of each video to avoid it, and also at end of each video.  Real Shame, as I really wanted to code my google home, but this has put me off trying.  Maybe just me, but I do not recommend this to a total novice. Not very well thought out or constructed.

response.content: Hey Vince, thank you for review. I have incorporated you feedback in my new courses. So thanks for pointing it out. I removed the talking head in some videos too so you can see the content.
response.content_html: Hey Vince, thank you for review. I have incorporated you feedback in my new courses. So thanks for pointing it out. I removed the talking head in some videos too so you can see the content.

results.content: Not sure if the captions on the videos were done by a 2nd grader or auto generated but they are terrible.  Hard to hear the instructor sometimes and the captions do not help at all with that issue. Course is also outdated from the conversion api.ai to DialogFlow.  Makes it hard to follow.
